labels.analysis: The MCP Chain of Draft (CoD) Prompt Tool is designed to enhance LLM prompt processing by applying CoD (Chain of Draft) or CoT (Chain of Thought) reasoning techniques. It reduces token usage while maintaining accuracy, making it efficient for problem-solving tasks. The available tools focus on deploying CoD for solving math, coding, and logic problems, as well as analyzing performance, token reduction, and problem complexity. This server is primarily geared toward optimizing LLM-based reasoning and analysis.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "AI/ML Tools" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around improving AI reasoning techniques with LLMs. Secondary labels include "Data Analysis & Processing" due to tools that analyze performance and complexity, and "Development Tools" since it aids in coding problem-solving. The custom label "Prompt Optimization" captures the unique aspect of transforming prompts to enhance efficiency and accuracy in problem-solving.

server_info_crawled.name: MCP Chain of Draft (CoD) Prompt Tool
server_info_crawled.author: @brendancopley/mcp-chain-of-draft-prompt-tool
server_info_crawled.overview: MCP Chain of Draft (CoD) Prompt Tool is a BYOLLM MCP (Model Context Protocol) tool that transforms your prompt using another LLM, applying CoD or CoT reasoning techniques, before delivering the final result. CoD is a novel paradigm that allows LLMs to generate minimalistic yet informative intermediate reasoning outputs while solving tasks, significantly reducing token usage while maintaining accuracy. For fast setup -> scroll ↓ click "Connect"! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- DO NOT be daunted by all the configurations—you can simply scroll down and hit “Connect” to get started effortlessly.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "LLM_MODEL": "claude-3-7-sonnet-latest",
  "COD_DB_URL": "sqlite:///cod_analytics.db",
  "LLM_PROVIDER": "anthropic",
  "COD_MAX_TOKENS": "500",
  "ENFORCE_FORMAT": "true",
  "COD_EXAMPLES_DB": "cod_examples.db",
  "OLLAMA_BASE_URL": "http://localhost:11434",
  "OPENAI_BASE_URL": "https://api.openai.com",
  "COD_DEFAULT_MODEL": "claude-3-7-sonnet-latest",
  "ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL": "https://api.anthropic.com",
  "ADAPTIVE_WORD_LIMIT": "true",
  "COD_MAX_WORDS_PER_STEP": "5"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@brendancopley/mcp-chain-of-draft-prompt-tool/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
